Ecosystem and environmental conditions: • There is limited information on factors affecting quillback recruitment, habitat, prey and predators, and competitors.
Assessment data inputs: • Catch reconstruction has uncertainty in some historical years due to periods of high and low estimates of sampled catch rates and when rockfish were not always sorted to species
Assessment model fits and structural unc: • Composition and index data were generally well fit.

Assessment data inputs: • Not captured in bottom trawl surveys. Indices based on fishery-dependent and other fishery-independent sources. Limited effect on population trends.
Assessment model fits and structural unc: • Recruitment and growth are estimated internally whereas natural mortality and steepness are based on priors.

Assessment data inputs: • Age data is limited compared to some other groundfish species and primarily occurs in the most recent 5-10 years. Covers commercial sector and suitable for growth estimation. Young fish remain sparse.
Assessment model fits and structural unc: • Profiles and jitters indicate the model is stable and that estimated parameters are genearlly well estimated.

Assessment data inputs: • Fewer samples of length data from fishing in recent years due to non-retention
Assessment model fits and structural unc: • Uncertainty in natural mortality estimates both in terms of uncertainty in longevity as well as limited information by which to clearly estimate value.

Assessment data inputs: • Length and age data are generally fit well across many assumptions.
Assessment model fits and structural unc: • Uncertainty in recruitment, particularly the strength of recruitment deviations in the mid 1990s.

Assessment data inputs: • Species-specific maturity and fecundity with both being collected from most recent years
Assessment model fits and structural unc: • Patterns of retrospective bias due to exclusion of age data over time.

Assessment data inputs: • Generally not a directly targeted species but most catch is landed.
